description: French tépale, from New Latin tēpalum, coined 1827 by transposition of French pétale (“petal”).

entries.meaning: (botany) Any component of the perianth (outermost whorls of flower parts, not involved in reproduction), especially when the components are not distinguished into sepals and petals.
examples: In Tulipa the pubescent tips of the tepals are quite interesting in particular those of T. fosteriana. The top of the tepal is initiated and develops before the reflexed, lateral parts.
